title: Assam picking up Bangladeshi illegals, dumping them in no-man's land
content: Assam's government is intensifying efforts to deport individuals declared illegal foreigners by tribunals, leading to legal challenges. Recent pushbacks into the India-Bangladesh border have prompted petitions to the Supreme Court and Gauhati HC, seeking the whereabouts of family members.

title: 2-year imprisonment for Mukhtar's son Abbas Ansari in 'hisab-kitab’ episode
content: Annas Ansari, son of the late Mukhtar Ansari, faces legal consequences. A court in Mau sentenced him to two years in jail. The case relates to a 2022 incident. Ansari allegedly made threatening remarks against officials at a public meeting. The court found him guilty under multiple sections of the IPC. This development follows a police investigation and ECI action.

title: Op Sindoor biggest, most successful anti-terror op in India's history: PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the BSF's women personnel for their bravery during Operation Sindoor, highlighting their crucial role in the successful counter-terrorism effort. He emphasized India's growing confidence in women's capabilities across various sectors, from defense to science. During the event, he released a commemorative coin for Ahilyabai Holkar and inaugurated development projects in Madhya Pradesh.

title: 5 dead in Guwahati landslides amid heavy rain in Assam; schools, colleges shut
content: At least five, including children, died in landslides in Guwahati's Kamrup (Metro) amid relentless monsoon rain. Over 10,000 people in Kamrup, Kamrup (Metro), and Cachar face urban flooding. Red alerts were issued across Assam, with schools shut and special leave granted to government employees as rain continues to batter the state.

title: Microsoft exec has a message for coders, after it laid off over 2k software engineers
content: Despite recent layoffs impacting software engineers, Microsoft's CPO, Aparna Chennapragada, defends the importance of computer science education. She argues AI is simply another layer of abstraction, transforming roles into "software operators" rather than eliminating them. As Microsoft invests heavily in AI, project managers will also adapt, focusing on editing and refining AI-generated ideas.

title: Delhi HC dismisses Lalu Yadav’s plea seeking stay in land-for-jobs scam case
content: The Delhi High Court has rejected Lalu Prasad Yadav's plea to halt trial court proceedings in the 'land-for-jobs' case. Yadav argued the CBI's investigation was invalid due to the lack of prior sanction under the Prevention of Corruption Act. The CBI countered, stating sanction was secured and Section 17A wasn't applicable, with the issue pending before the Supreme Court.

title: 'Game isn't over until Bumrah's done bowling': De Villiers after MI beat GT
content: Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling performance led Mumbai Indians to a 20-run victory over Gujarat Titans in the IPL 2025 Eliminator. AB de Villiers lauded Bumrah as a game-changer, emphasizing his impact until the very end. Bumrah's crucial dismissal of Washington Sundar shifted the momentum, while Hardik Pandya's strategic use of Bumrah and Sai Sudharsan's dismissal proved pivotal.

title: Non-veg breakfast removed from Chennai Vande Bharat trains
content: Commuters on Chennai's Vande Bharat Express trains are expressing discontent over the sudden unavailability of non-vegetarian breakfast options, despite the absence of any prior notification from Southern Railway or IRCTC. Passengers report encountering misleading information during booking and receiving only vegetarian meals onboard.

title: Bluru’s first Apple Store likely to open soon: Annual rent and more details
content: Apple is expanding its retail presence in India with a new store in Bengaluru's Phoenix Mall of Asia, leasing nearly 8,000 square feet for ten years. Following Mumbai and Delhi, this will be Apple's third Indian outlet. The lease, commencing November 8, 2024, involves an annual rent of Rs 2.09 crore and a revenue-sharing agreement.

title: IPL: Bairstow's Sehwag-like knock neutralises GT's 'trump card' Krishna
content: Jonny Bairstow, after being written off and going unsold in the IPL auction, silenced his critics with a blistering knock in the Eliminator. His aggressive assault on Prasidh Krishna, reminiscent of Sehwag's dominance over Gul, propelled Mumbai Indians to a commanding total.

title: 'Ridiculous Rahul': BJP slams Cong after Salman Khurshid's support for Op Sindoor
content: Following Salman Khurshid's endorsement of the government's handling of Jammu & Kashmir and Pakistan, including the abrogation of Article 370 and Operation Sindoor, the BJP has launched an attack against Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of echoing Pakistani propaganda.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to staff in Town Hall: 6000 job cuts were related to…
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella attributed recent layoffs to reorganization rather than performance, impacting even product development roles. The company is aggressively pushing its Copilot AI assistants, securing a significant deal with Barclays for 100,000 licenses. While adoption is growing, some clients are proceeding cautiously, awaiting clearer returns on Microsoft's AI investments.

title: 6 dead, 5 injured as car carrying wedding guests overturns in UP's Hardoi
content: A tragic accident in Hardoi claimed six lives and injured five others early Saturday. The incident occurred near Ghazipur village when a car carrying wedding guests overturned, reportedly due to the driver losing control. Among the deceased were two brothers and a young child. Police are investigating the crash, which happened as the vehicle returned to Pali from Kusuma village.

title: Monsoon mayhem: Kerala receives 6x rainfall in a week
content: Kerala has experienced significantly above-normal rainfall since the early arrival of the southwest monsoon, with some districts recording over five times the usual amount. Tragically, heavy rains and strong winds have caused widespread disruption, resulting in the deaths of three fishermen in separate incidents. Authorities are currently conducting search operations for the missing fisherman.

title: 250 million bees escape after truck overturns in US
content: A truck accident in Washington state released millions of honeybees. The incident occurred near the Canadian border. Authorities closed roads to manage the situation. Beekeepers are helping to rescue the bees. The goal is to allow the bees to return to their hives. Honeybees are crucial for pollination and food production.

title: Covid-19 in India: Active infections reach 2,710, 7 dead
content: India is witnessing a resurgence of Covid-19, with active cases surpassing 2,500, led by Kerala, Maharashtra, and Delhi. Health Minister Prataprao Jadhav assures that the government is fully prepared with comprehensive measures and is closely monitoring the situation across all states.

title: 'Couldn’t find his way out of his own closet': Biden was reportedly lost in White House
content: Senator Josh Hawley claimed former President Joe Biden was disoriented, even getting lost in his White House closet, citing a Secret Service whistleblower. Congressional investigations are examining Biden's cognitive state, with concerns raised about staff potentially acting without his knowledge.

title: Theatre practitioner denied entry to Kolkata auditorium for wearing lungi
content: A theatre artist faced entry denial at GD Birla Sabhagar due to wearing a lungi. This incident ignited a debate in Kolkata's cultural circles. The discussion revolves around dress codes in auditoriums. Some support casual attire like lungis. Others advocate for smart casual dress, similar to international venues. The auditorium management apologized and clarified their policy.

title: IndiGo pilot found dead at Telangana flat
content: An IndiGo pilot, identified as 42-year-old Adik Amrith Raj, was discovered deceased in his Kokapet apartment after neighbors reported a foul odor. Police found his body in a decomposed state, indicating he had been dead for several days.

title: Trump says 'US very close to making deal with India', claims Pak delegates to visit next week
content: Donald Trump announced that the US is nearing a trade deal with India, while Pakistan representatives are expected in Washington for talks. He cautioned that conflict between India and Pakistan could jeopardize these agreements. Tensions are high following India's 'Operation Sindoor' in response to a terror attack. India is expected to allow US companies to bid for government contracts.

title: Scripps Spelling Bee: Indian-Americans steal the show with top three positions
content: In a thrilling conclusion to the 2025 Scripps National Spelling Bee, Faizan Zaki, a 13-year-old from Dallas, triumphed after spelling “Chaldee” correctly. Zaki's victory was a redemption story, having narrowly missed the title last year. The competition, featuring top young spellers, showcased remarkable skill and poise.

title: JAC class 12th result declared: 91.2% pass in commerce, 79.26% in science
content: The Jharkhand Academic Council (JAC) has declared the Class 12 Science and Commerce results for the 2024–25 academic session. Science recorded a 79.26% pass rate, while Commerce achieved 91.2%. Results are available online at jacresults.com and results.digilocker.gov.in from 12:30 PM. Students can check their marks using roll code and number. Revaluation and supplementary exams are scheduled for those needing them, with toppers’ lists to be published alongside the results.

title: New Covid vaccine approved by US FDA: Here's all about it
content: The US FDA has approved Moderna's new COVID-19 vaccine, mNEXSPIKE, amidst emerging coronavirus variants. It is approved for adults 65 and older, and individuals aged 12-64 with underlying risk factors. Moderna's CEO, Stéphane Bancel, highlighted its importance as a tool against severe COVID-19, noting over 47,000 American deaths in 2024.

title: 'They do it through bullets, we do it through trade': Trump 'most proud' of India-Pak ceasefire
content: US President Trump claimed that US intervention, leveraging trade, averted a potential nuclear war between India and Pakistan. However, India firmly denied US mediation in the ceasefire, emphasizing it was a sovereign decision. The Ministry of External Affairs refuted Trump's assertion that trade influenced the resolution, stating Operation Sindoor was a response to terrorism, aligning with India's doctrine.

title: What’s in a name? Just ask Nitish, and Nitesh: How a name twin fooled jail officials in Faridabad
content: In Faridabad, a rape accused named Nitish Kumar Pandey escaped from district jail. He exploited a name similarity with another inmate, Nitesh, who had secured bail. Both inmates had the same father's name in records. Jail officials failed to verify identities properly. Two officials were suspended, and an inquiry was ordered. Police are searching for Pandey in Patna.

title: 'What people say...': RJ Mahvash shares cryptic Instagram story
content: RJ Mahvash, recently linked to Yuzvendra Chahal, attended an IPL match between Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bangalore, sparking public interest due to Chahal's recent divorce. She shared photos in Punjab Kings colours and a cryptic message addressing relationship speculation, while disabling comments on her post. Mahvash and Chahal have consistently denied any romantic involvement, maintaining they are just friends.

title: World no tobacco day: Why kicking the habit matters more than ever
content: World No Tobacco Day, observed annually on May 31st, serves as a global call to action, highlighting the detrimental effects of tobacco use and encouraging cessation. The initiative addresses the health risks, economic burdens, and environmental impacts associated with smoking and vaping, while also emphasizing the dangers of secondhand smoke.

title: Sai Sudharsan banks on County experience to excel in England
content: Gujarat Titans' Sai Sudharsan, disappointed after their IPL loss, is banking on his County experience with Surrey to prepare for a challenging Test series in England. He acknowledges the difficulty of switching from white-ball to red-ball cricket and will focus on foundational techniques.

title: ‘Slapped, beaten with baton’: CCSU warden removed for thrashing hostellers in Meerut
content: Chaudhary Charan Singh University's Kailash Prakash Hostel warden, DK Chauhan, was removed after students protested his alleged assault on hostellers for a minor infraction. A video surfaced showing Chauhan beating students with a baton, sparking outrage and demands for his removal.

title: Half of Guwahati under water after 37mm rain in 24 hours; red alert for today
content: Guwahati grappled with extensive flooding after 37mm of rainfall, disrupting daily life and prompting government intervention, including special leave for employees and school closures. A man in Mizoram died due to a wall collapse amid severe weather. Flight diversions and ferry service suspensions added to the chaos, while authorities responded to landslides and provided emergency assistance in the flood-stricken city.

title: Trump's 'door remains closed' advice to Macron after wife shoving row
content: Following a viral video showing Brigitte Macron playfully shoving her husband, US President Donald Trump offered marital advice to Emmanuel Macron, humorously suggesting he keep the door closed. Macron dismissed the incident as an overblown joke between him and his wife during their arrival in Vietnam. He downplayed the media attention, emphasizing their playful relationship.

title: Meerut drum case: Ex-merchant navy officer's wife plans to study law in jail
content: Muskan Rastogi, accused of murdering her husband, an ex-merchant navy officer, has expressed her desire to study law while incarcerated in Meerut's Chaudhary Charan Singh District Jail. Claiming inadequate legal support, she aims to represent herself. Jail officials are exploring options for her to pursue legal studies through IGNOU, despite her lacking the required senior secondary certificate.

title: Watch: Chief engineer throws bundles of Rs 500 notes from flat during raid
content: Odisha Vigilance Department recovered approximately Rs 2.1 crore in cash during raids at multiple locations linked to Baikuntha Nath Sarangi, a chief engineer. Sarangi allegedly attempted to dispose of bundles of cash from his Bhubaneswar flat as vigilance officers arrived. The searches were prompted by allegations of disproportionate assets, with significant amounts seized from his residences in Bhubaneswar and Angul

title: 'Double face, which face of Pak do we talk to?': MJ Akbar at Copenhagen
content: An Indian all-party delegation, led by BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad, visited Copenhagen to address the Indian diaspora and raise global awareness about terrorism. MJ Akbar criticised Pakistan's "double-faced" nature and questioned their sincerity in dialogue. The delegation emphasised Indian unity against Pakistan's cross-border terrorism and drug trafficking, urging the international community to recognize the seriousness of the issue.

title: Trump administration targets Harvard with tougher visa screening measures
content: The US State Department, under Marco Rubio, has ordered enhanced visa vetting for anyone connected to Harvard University, citing concerns about anti-Semitism and violence on campus. This unprecedented move includes scrutiny of social media and aims to identify individuals with problematic histories.

title: 'Calm down': Bumrah gestures to MI coach Jayawardene in win vs GT
content: Mumbai Indians defeated Gujarat Titans by 20 runs in a high-scoring IPL 2025 Eliminator, with Jasprit Bumrah's crucial dismissal of Washington Sundar turning the tide. Despite Sai Sudharsan's impressive 80, Gujarat fell short of the 229-run target. Bumrah's economical bowling and confident demeanor propelled Mumbai into Qualifier 2 against Punjab Kings.

title: Over 5 lakh face deportation: Trump gets nod to end legal status of migrants from Supreme Court
content: The US Supreme Court has allowed the Trump administration to proceed with ending temporary legal protections for over 500,000 migrants from Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua, and Venezuela, potentially impacting nearly a million migrants. This decision lifts a lower-court order blocking the termination of the humanitarian parole program.

title: WWE SmackDown 5/30 Results: Cena-Rhodes face off, top star returns, NXT debuts
content: SmackDown in Knoxville saw Bianca Belair's homecoming, a Money in the Bank qualifier won by Naomi, and Andrade securing a spot in the men's ladder match. The show also featured wins for J.C. Matteo and Zelina Vega, plus Los Garza defeating Rey Fenix and Je'Von Evans.

title: Pankaj Tripathi as Baburao in ‘Hera Pheri 3? Fans say ‘next best choice’ after Paresh Rawal
content: The comedy franchise 'Hera Pheri' faces uncertainty as Paresh Rawal exits 'Hera Pheri 3,' leaving fans disappointed. An AI-generated image of Pankaj Tripathi as Baburao has sparked mixed reactions online, with some fans open to the idea while others prefer Paresh Rawal. Tripathi himself humbly declined, expressing respect for Rawal's portrayal, leaving the future of the film uncertain.

title: Uttarakhand rains: 1 killed, 5 injured in landslide on Kedarnath National Highway
content: A devastating landslide on the Kedarnath National Highway in Rudraprayag claimed the life of a 38-year-old driver and left five pilgrims injured. The incident, near Kund close to Guptkashi, involved a vehicle carrying pilgrims from Chhattisgarh. Rescue teams swiftly responded, transporting the injured to Augustmuni Hospital, where two are in serious condition.

title: Donald Trump announces 50% tariff on steel imports from June 4 to 'secure industry in US'
content: President Trump announced a doubling of steel import tariffs to 50% at a US Steel plant in Pennsylvania, aiming to further protect the domestic steel industry. This increase, however, could potentially lead to higher prices for steel-containing products. While initially opposing Nippon Steel's acquisition of US Steel, Trump now supports a deal involving partial ownership, ensuring the company remains American.

title: Watch: Nehra's son, Gill's sister reduced to tears after Gujarat Titans lose
content: Gujarat Titans faced a heartbreaking exit from IPL 2025 after a 20-run defeat to Mumbai Indians in the Eliminator. Despite leading the league stage, late-season losses led to their downfall, triggering emotional reactions from players' families in the stands. Mumbai Indians' victory propelled them to Qualifier 2, while Gujarat Titans' promising season ended in disappointment.

title: Death toll in rain-induced disasters across northeast reaches 10
content: The Assam State Disaster Management Authority confirmed the death of five people in landslides in and around Guwahati

title: Operation Sindoor: CDS Anil Chauhan says India suffered initial losses in the air, declines to give details
content: Chief of Defence Staff Anil Chauhan said in an interview that India suffered initial losses in the air, but declined to give details.

title: COVID-19: T.N. health officers told to ensure early detection, reporting of ILI and SARI cases
content: The Directorate of Public Health and Preventive Medicine, in a communication to district, city, and municipal health officers, said that recent reports indicate a resurgence of COVID-19 cases across various parts of the country

title: Undernourished and overweight: Telangana youth face dual health burden of malnutrition
content: Broader public health measures that go beyond food subsidies and address early-life nutritional inequalities were suggested by Dr. P. Prudhvikar Reddy

title: Neolithic habitation found in Assam’s Dima Hasao
content: Furnace and iron slag found at Daojali Hading point to early metallurgical practices more than 2,700 years ago

title: Heavy rainfall, hailstorm hit Ramban; Srinagar lashed by showers
content: The IMD has advised residents to stay cautious due to the potential for heavy rain and strong winds in isolated areas across Jammu & Kashmir.

title: Five evaluators suspended for gross errors in evaluation of SSC Public Examination answer scripts in Andhra Pradesh
content: In the wake of the serious errors, Andhra Pradesh Government also proposes to modify the OMR design, starting from SSC 2026 to minimise counting errors

title: 100 days: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta highlights policy push, integrity in governance
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta emphasised that her administration had laid focus on policy formulation, rather than making "false promises."

title: Rains LIVE: Landslides hit northeast States amid heavy rain; flooding affects life along Kerala-Karnataka coast
content: Several people were feared dead after five houses and a hotel collapsed due to landslides triggered by heavy rain in Mizoram’s Lawngtlai

title: One more tests positive for COVID-19 in Arunachal Pradesh; tally rises to three
content: “The Health Department is closely monitoring the situation and taking all necessary precautions to prevent the spread of the virus,” an official said

title: Not joining UDF, will not contest in Nilambur bypoll: P.V. Anvar
content: Anvar expresses disappointment with UDF, stating the front gave him ‘false hopes and kept him waiting’ despite his assurance that he would support their chosen candidate

title: Several feared dead as 5 houses, hotel collapse in Mizoram amid heavy rain
content: The landslides trapped people from Myanmar; rescue operation underway by local authorities and volunteers

title: Five killed in landslide as heavy rain causes floods in parts of Assam
content: The Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said all five deaths have been reported from the Kamrup Metropolitan district.

title: Valmik Thapar, wildlife conservationist, tiger-advocate, passes away at 73
content: Valmik Thapar was part of more than 150 government panels and task forces, including the National Board for Wildlife, which is led by the prime minister.

title: Security forces engage in encounter with Maoists in Jharkhand's Jhariakela
content: Encounter with Maoists in Jhariakela, Jharkhand leads to recovery of explosives; Maoist activity in India decreasing

title: In West Bengal, students transitioning from schools to colleges stare at uncertainty
content: The State Education Minister said that legal matters will not impact the admission process and that the portal would be open soon

title: ‘When will PM Modi break his silence?’ Congress on Trump’s truce claims
content: The government has maintained that issues between India and Pakistan will be resolved bilaterally and without any third-party intervention

title: Haryana to conduct statewide civil defence exercise 'Operation Shield' on May 31
content: A controlled blackout of 15 minutes will be observed from 8 p.m. to 8.15 p.m. near vital installations, with exception of essential emergency services such as hospitals, fire stations, and police stations

title: Nine militants arrested in Manipur
content: Intelligence-based combing and search operations are being carried out extensively to arrest those involved in extortion activities in Manipur

title: Colombia withdraws statement condoling deaths in Pakistan, will issue strong support for India: Shashi Tharoor
content: BJP leader Taranjit Singh Sandhu said that the delegation’s detailed briefing helped reverse the Colombian stance

title: Army chief awards felicitates woman BSF officer for exceptional courage during Operation Sindoor
content: Commanding a border outpost within eyeball-to-eyeball contact of a Pakistani post along the International Border, the assistant commandant led her troops to silence three forward hostile posts across the zero line (the area closest to enemy territory) by giving a befitting reply.

title: Why is Pollachi sexual assault verdict unique? | Explained
content: Did Victim A exaggerate the offence committed against her? What was the goof up in the charge sheets related to Victim B? Why SC/ST Act was not invoked with respect to Victims C and E? How did A6 get convicted for raping Victims D & H though he did not involve in any sexual act? Why didn’t Victim F testify in court leading to acquittal of accused? How did the court deal with defence arguments?

title: Rain fury continues unabated in Ernakulam
content: “The failure to de-silt and deepen major canals, especially the Thevara Perandoor Canal, Karanakkodam Canal and Edappally Canal within the city has affected areas in its immediate neighbourhood, a Congress councillor and UDF parliamentary party secretary in Kochi Corporation said

title: Will challenge lower court verdict in HC, seek death penalty for convicts: Ankita Bhandari's parents
content: A bigger battle is yet to be fought so that the killers get the death penalty and people think a thousand times before doing this to anyone's daughter, said Ms. Devi as she broke into tears while talking to reporters after the verdict

title: A.P. CM Chandrababu Naidu rolls out red carpet for investors, promises record-time clearances
content: The Chief Minister invites industrialists to invest in Andhra Pradesh and promises swift processing of applications and record-time clearances

title: Councillors oppose outsourcing of operation, maintenance of crematoriums
content: Two agencies have been identified and they have been told to collect ₹2,500 for cremation procedures and pay the Corporation ₹100; decision on the issue put off

title: India will have 1 billion Internet users by this fiscal: Jyotiraditya Scindia
content: The BharatNet investments in rural and remote connectivity are the largest in the world, says Minister of Communications and Development of North Eastern Region; almost 2.14 lakh gram panchayats were connected in the first phase and the next phase is about connecting another 2.64 lakh gram panchayats, he says, adding that a central network operating hub will be put in place for maintenance

title: A nine-year-old bonded labourer
content: Last week, a duck farmer was arrested on charges of keeping a child from Andhra Pradesh as ‘collateral’ for a loan and then killing him in Tamil Nadu. Though bonded labour has long been banned by law, it continues to be practised, say activists. Nellore Sravani reports on how the boy’s mother, Ankamma, a woman from a tribal community, tried in vain to bring her child back home

title: Karnataka reports third COVID-19 death
content: The patient, who was admitted to the hospital with breathlessness, altered sensorium, oliguria, and generalised swelling of the body, was vaccinated with two doses of Covishield and had chronic kidney disease (CKD) and bronchiectasis, a chronic lung condition

title: Denial of Rajya Sabha seat to Vaiko won’t affect alliance, says Durai Vaiko
content: Recalling that Vaiko has declined Cabinet berths at the Centre thrice, he reiterates that the MDMK leader has never been after posts or positions, so the alliance will continue in the interest of the State

title: Dental clinic’s unsterile practices led to death of 8 in Vaniyambadi: study
content: Tirupattur Collector to order closure of the clinic after study reveals that use of unsterile surgical instrument allegedly led to death of eight patients after they contracted neuro melioidosis in 2023

title: I have got my freedom and party can move forward: Anbumani Ramadoss
content: He reiterates that all appointments made within the party, including president, general secretary, and treasurer, could only be made by the party’s general council

title: Bare borders: A.P. Coastal Security Police left adrift without boats or backing
content: Once a vigilant coast that helped sink Pakistani submarine PNS Ghazi, Andhra’s shoreline now lies exposed with defunct boats, short-staffed stations and key proposals gathering dust

title: Amid protests, Union Home Secretary may visit Manipur next week
content: Coordination Committee for Manipur Integrity, an Imphal-based Meitei civil society group, has called for the removal of all top government officials in the State, including the DGP and the Chief Secretary

title: Bank frauds growing under Modi rule: Congress chief Kharge
content: Congress president criticises PM Modi for rising bank frauds, accusing his government of “fraud and fakery”

title: HC sets aside Alwal Tahsildar’s order declaring Tholla Karkhana land as government property
content: The HC instructed the revenue officials to issue appropriate notices to the affected parties before removing them from the land to declare the property as government land

title: Karnataka on its way to emerge as leading MRO hub in Asia: M.B. Patil
content: State gets ready for a serious MRO play after it sees significant investments from various players, including Air India, Tata Advanced Systems Ltd., and HAL-Airbus, and latest entrant being IndiGo

title: Working closely with India on defence, security issues: New Zealand Deputy PM
content: Freedom of navigation in the Indo-Pacific region is “crucial” for New Zealand; the country’s foreign policy reset includes a higher focus on south and southeast Asia; emphasises safeguarding rights of small states

title: Need clarity on disposal and return process for cut medicine strips and surgical products: Bangalore Chemists’ Association
content: Early this week, CDSCO released a guidance document for safe disposal of unused and expired medicines

title: T.N. cooperative banks will support the poor and downtrodden, says Stalin
content: He accuses the Union government of not considering the welfare of the people and instead attacking them through the RBI, first with demonetisation and now the fresh gold loan norms

title: MSMEs in Karnataka should not rely on other countries like China for machinery or maintenance: DKS
content: Some MSME units are dependent on Chinese machinery, and with trade barriers introduced by the Donald Trump administration, they were not able to get their machines serviced on time

title: Three die as heavy rain lashes Meghalaya; search operations for missing couple from Indore to resume on May 31
content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K. Sangma has announced compensation of ₹4 lakh to their next of relatives

title: Centre asks States to raise enrolment in government schools
content: MoE raises concerns with Uttarakhand, Telangana, T.N., Andhra Pradesh, says States must identify root cause, take remedial steps; Maharashtra, Kerala attribute trend to data cleansing exercises

title: IMA opposes proposed integrated MBBS-BAMS course, calls it unscientific
content: Calling the move ‘unfortunate’, it said this ‘unscientific mixing of various systems of medicines will not benefit doctors or patients’

title: Tension in Saharanpur village after demolition of under-construction mosque
content: Local MP Imran Masood alleges violation of legal procedure; administration cites illegality, maintains due process followed

title: New Centre of Digital and AI Excellence inaugurated at KL University
content: CODE is designed to give KL University students hands-on exposure to real-world industry applications , effectively bridging the gap between academic learning and industry demands

title: Kerala shipwreck: Debris from sunken cargo vessel affects 22 coastal villages in Kanniyakumari
content: Plastic pellets, wooden logs, and cashew nuts have begun washing ashore in the villages in the past three days. The district administration has established a 24x7 control room

title: NHRC issues notice to Odisha government over assault of journalist
content: The journalist was attacked by a group of people when he went to a construction site at Kulthipali village in Balangir district on May 25

title: Ensure engineering colleges do not collect excess fee, National Council for Scheduled Tribes (NCST) tells OU, Kakatiya and JNTUH
content: ‘Review fee violations by Pvt. Engg. colleges over past years and ensure candidates certificates are not retained; blacklist colleges that violate norms’

title: Three more start-ups selected to get GPU access for Indian AI models
content: Soket AI, Gnani AI and Gan AI have been selected to build an indigenous foundational AI model, alongside SarvamAI, which was selected to receive access to government-procured GPUs earlier this year

title: Harish Rao demands White Paper on hydel projects planned in Himachal Pradesh
content: The BRS leader says Moser Baer and NTPC had backed out from constructing the two projects after finding them unfeasible

title: Four dead as rain continues to batter Kerala
content: Efforts on to trace several people who were reported missing, including nine fishers who have gone out to sea in two fishing boats in Thiruvananthapuram district

title: LDF united in spirit, will win next election too: D. Raja
content: Dismissing allegations of lack of intra-party democracy within LDF, he says the coalition functions through regular discussions and collective decision-making

title: KTR showcases Telangana’s growth during BRS rule at London meet
content: He speaks on ‘why Telangana matters’ and on the State’s progress in various sectors at the Bridge India Week event

title: Lawsuit accuses Zion of rape, years of abuse
content: A woman has accused Pelicans forward Zion Williamson of rape in addition to "sexual, physical, emotional and financial" abuse during a relationship that lasted from 2018 to 2023, according to a lawsuit submitted to Los Angeles Superior Court.

title: Sources: Dodgers' Betts out due to fractured toe
content: Dodgers star Mookie Betts will miss the rest of the series against the Yankees after sources confirmed he has a fractured toe.

title: Trout returns in new spot, has hit in Angels' win
content: Angels slugger Mike Trout was activated off the injured list and went 1-for-5 as the designated hitter in Friday night's 4-1 win over the Guardians.

title: Sources: 49ers finalizing deal for Eagles DE Huff
content: The San Francisco 49ers and Philadelphia Eagles are working to finalize a trade that will send edge rusher Bryce Huff to San Francisco for a midround pick, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Alcaraz 'suffered quite a lot,' but advances in Paris
content: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz reached the fourth round of the French Open after laboring past Damir Dzumhur 6-1, 6-3, 4-6, 6-4 in the Friday night session.

title: Wings' Bueckers placed into concussion protocol
content: Wings point guard Paige Bueckers will miss at least two games after being placed in the concussion protocol after Thursday's loss to the Sky.

title: MMA fighter Davis leads antitrust suit vs. the UFC
content: Veteran MMA fighter Phil Davis, a former champion with Bellator, has filed an antitrust lawsuit against the UFC accusing the promotion of a "predatory scheme to undermine would be competitors."

title: Sources: FBI probes MLBPA business partnership
content: Sources tell ESPN that agents reached out to at least three players regarding their knowledge of financial dealings related to MLBPA's OneTeam partnership.

title: 🐝 Texas teen spells 'eclaircissement' to win title
content: Faizan Zaki went from runner-up last year to champion at the Scripps National Spelling Bee by outlasting eight other spellers to win the title on Thursday night.

title: Something about this OKC team looks familiar — and the NBA should be terrified
content: The Thunder have followed in the footsteps of the 2014-15 Golden State Warriors this season. Is a future dynasty in the making?

title: Saigo leads, Korda surges at U.S. Women's Open
content: Saigo shot a 6-under 66 on Friday to take the second-round lead at the U.S. Women's Open. At 8-under 136, the 23-year-old Japanese player had a three-stroke advantage over a group of six led by top-ranked Nelly Korda.

title: 19 NFL stars who could get massive contracts this summer: Everything we know about negotiations
content: Our experts have the latest buzz on 19 players and their potential new deals, including multiple Chiefs, Jets and Broncos stars.

title: Panthers-Oilers II: Key stats to know for the 2025 Stanley Cup Final
content: For the second consecutive season, it's Florida-Edmonton. Here's what you need to know before Game 1.

title: PSG vs. Inter Milan: Ultimate UEFA Champions League final preview, predictions
content: Saturday's showpiece final between PSG and Inter Milan has storylines galore, from the battle of MVP goalkeepers to PSG's treble quest and so much more. Here's everything you need to know.

title: Liverpool confirm Frimpong deal after TAA exit
content: Liverpool have signed Jeremie Frimpong from Bayer Leverkusen, the Premier League champions confirmed on Friday.

title: Source: Liverpool bid club-record $147M for Wirtz
content: Liverpool have submitted a club-record €130 million bid to sign Bayer Leverkusen playmaker Florian Wirtz this summer, a source has told ESPN.

title: Mexico confirms co-hosting 2031 WWC with U.S.
content: Mexico confirmed it will co-host the 2031 Women's World Cup with the United States in FIFA's first expanded 48-team tournament.

title: LAFC chases 'massive' $9.5M Club World Cup spot
content: LAFC will host Club América in a high-stakes play-in match on Saturday night for the final spot in the expanded FIFA Club World Cup.

title: Dembélé: Focused on UCL title not Ballon d'Or
content: Paris Saint-Germain forward Ousmane Dembélé has said that a potential Ballon d'Or award is at the back of his mind as he prepares for Saturday's Champions League final.

title: San Diego FC to ban 33 fans over postgame brawl
content: San Diego FC announced 33 individuals will be banned indefinitely from attending all club and MLS matches after a violent clash between supporters following a match against the LA Galaxy.

title: Hayes: Starlet Yohannes has big USWNT future
content: USWNT head coach Emma Hayes sung the praises of 17-year-old midfielder Lily Yohannes again on Friday, saying Yohannes has a bright future with the program.

title: Alexander-Arnold joins Real Madrid, set for CWC
content: Real Madrid have signed Trent Alexander-Arnold, with a source telling ESPN the clubs agreed to a €10m deal for his early release for the Club World Cup.

title: Where Clark, Bueckers fit in MVP, Rookie of the Year race
content: Just two weeks into the season, the WNBA MVP and Rookie of the Year races have clear frontrunners. Andre Snellings looks at the best bets to make right now.

title: Updated NBA draft rankings: How the NCAA withdrawal deadline shook up the top 100
content: With 18 of our top 100 NBA prospects returning to college, there's movement in our list, starting at No. 5.

title: NBA draft withdrawal deadline: NIL's impact, Florida's gain, the 2026 draft, more
content: Who are biggest winners and losers from prospects' decisions to stay or go? We answer the burning questions.

title: USC trolls Oregon, Dan Lanning's pool jump with 'Anchorman' commitment alert
content: Lanning went viral in early May for jumping in a pool with five-star recruit Richard Wesley after Wesley's commitment to Oregon. Wesley decommitted on May 27.

title: Conference USA preview: Liberty is early favorite but contenders abound
content: The Flames are the team to beat, but Western Kentucky and Jacksonville State (among others) can't be counted out.

title: Why the Maple Leafs shouldn't re-sign Mitch Marner -- and what they should do instead
content: Toronto has some franchise-altering decisions to make this summer, starting with the perennial All-Star.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The first transfer window is set to open across Europe on June 1, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs eye move for Spurs' Son
content: Tottenham's Son Heung-Min is linked with a possible move to the Saudi Pro League. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: How many fights is Erin Blanchfield away from a title shot?
content: Erin Blanchfield, Tatsuro Taira and Song Yadong have all headlined ESPN's top 25 MMA fighters under 25 list, but none has fought for a UFC title. Whose path is closest to the belt?

title: Can Jermall Charlo, Caleb Plant gain steam on collision course?
content: Charlo and Plant fight on separate bouts on Saturday. Andreas Hale lists five things to know ahead of the fight.

title: Rekha Gupta Marks 100 Days As Delhi Chief Minister, Highlights Policy Push
content: Rekha Gupta dubbed as successful her government's Vaya Vandana scheme, which offers citizens aged 70 and above health insurance coverage of up to Rs 10 lakh.

title: Trump Administration Orders "Extra Vetting" For Anyone Travelling To Harvard
content: Per the cable, dated May 30th, if an individual seeks to work at, attend or otherwise visit to Harvard, in the prescreening or interviewing process, consular offices have been instructed to refuse the visa "pending review of their online presence".

title: "Government With Double Face": MJ Akbar On Why Talks With Pak Are A "Bluff"
content: The Centre has formed many delegations as a part of its diplomatic outreach program after Operation Sindoor - a targeted military strike on terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK).

title: "Our PM Vajpayee...": Nitish Kumar's Gaffe At PM Modi's Bihar Rally
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi during a massive rally in Rohtas district for giving a nod for caste census.

title: Exclusive: Chandrababu Naidu Says "Good Friend" Bill Gates Initially Refused To Meet Him
content: In an exclusive NDTV interview, N Chandrababu Naidu discussed how he established his friendship with Bill Gates after a meeting in Delhi.

title: "They're Going To Be Okay": Trump On Chinese Students Amid Visa Crackdown
content: Trump's administration this week said it would specifically target permissions for Chinese students, in its latest broadside against US higher education.

title: Gautam Adani Congratulates First Batch Of Women NDA Cadets
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Saturday lauded the first batch of women National Defence Academy (NDA) cadets for scripting history in the annals of the Indian armed forces.

title: Amarnath Yatra Registration Begins Online, Offline: Here's How To Enroll
content: The Shri Amarnath Shrine Board (SASB), which manages the yatra, started the registrations for the trip on April 15.

title: Analysis: India's Big Political Families And Their Bitter Feuds
content: Every regional political party in India, barring one or two notable exceptions like the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) in Tamil Nadu, are a family enterprise. Succession battles put father against son, brother against brother.

title: Top Defence Officer Confirms India Lost Fighter Jets In Pakistan Conflict
content: India's military confirmed for the first time that it lost an unspecified number of fighter jets in clashes with Pakistan in May, while saying the four-day conflict never came close to the point of nuclear war.

title: Bengal Man Beheads Relative, Parades Her Head Before Surrendering To Cops
content: A man killed his sister-in-law by beheading her with a sharp weapon, and roamed the streets carrying the severed head and the bloodied weapon.

title: Birth Control Increases Stroke Risk, Says Study. What Women Need To Know
content: Surprisingly, in younger adults  particularly women  cryptogenic strokes make up approximately 40% of all strokes.

title: Video: UK Prison Inmates Smile, Then Beat Sex Offender To Death

title: Wildlife Conservationist Valmik Thapar Dies At 73
content: Valmik Thapar, one of India's most eminent wildlife conservationists and authors, died at his residence Saturday morning. He was 73.
